intro: Trichocyclus simplex, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its spread along the coastline. Trichocyclus simplex is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
